tool.name: OSMGPDiffLoader

param.name: in_osmURL
param.displayname: OpenStreetMap planet diff files base download URL
param.dialogReference: Download URL for the planet diff files. The parameter specifies the base URL for the hour-replicate and minute-replicate directories.
param.pythonReference: Download URL for the planet diff files. The parameter specifies the base URL for the hour-replicate and minute-replicate directories.

param.name: in_targetdataset
param.dialogReference: The target dataset to be synchronized with the OpenStreetMap server data.
param.pythonReference: The target dataset to be synchronized with the OpenStreetMap server data.

param.name: in_syncstarttime
param.dialogReference: Specify a start time for the synchronization. The time needs to be provided in UTC and expressed according to ISO 8601. For example 2011-03-04T14:00:00, means March 4th, 2011 2 p.m.. The parameter is optional and if no argument is provided the synchroniztion will be made for the last hour.
param.pythonReference: Specify a start time for the synchronization. The time needs to be provided in UTC and expressed according to ISO 8601. For example 2011-03-04T14:00:00, means March 4th, 2011 2 p.m.. The parameter is optional and if no argument is provided the synchroniztion will be made for the last hour.

param.name: in_updateinsideAOI
param.displayname: Load updates only inside current AOI
param.dialogReference:
The parameter decides if only new or updated data within the current area of interest for the current dataset with be recorded. If for example the target dataset contains data for the Netherlands and the parameter is set then only updates within the extent of the Netherlands will be recorded. Changes for example in Asia will be omitted.

  • UPDATE_INSIDE_AOI: only updates (create/modify/delete) actions that fall inside the extent of the target dataset are recorded.

  • UPDATE_EVERYTHING: all updates from the planet diff file are recorded in the database.
param.pythonReference:
The parameter decides if only new or updated data within the current area of interest for the current dataset with be recorded. If for example the target dataset contains data for the Netherlands and the parameter is set then only updates within the extent of the Netherlands will be recorded. Changes for example in Asia will be omitted.

  • UPDATE_INSIDE_AOI: only updates (create/modify/delete) actions that fall inside the extent of the target dataset are recorded.

  • UPDATE_EVERYTHING: all updates from the planet diff file are recorded in the database.

param.name: in_logginglevel
param.dialogReference:
The parameter specifies the amount of logging information provided by the tool.

  • NORMAL_LOGGING: Only loading errors or warnings are reported. This is the default setting.

  • VERBOSE_LOGGING: Each loading openation from the planet diff file is recorded as well as warning and errors.
param.pythonReference:
The parameter specifies the amount of logging information provided by the tool.

  • NORMAL_LOGGING: Only loading errors or warnings are reported. This is the default setting.

  • VERBOSE_LOGGING: Each loading openation from the planet diff file is recorded as well as warning and errors.

tool.summary: This tool allow the user to apply planet diff files to synchronize server changes back to the local OpenStreetMap representation.
tool.usage: This tool allow the user to apply planet diff files to synchronize server changes back to the local OpenStreetMap representation.
